item.title: Hugo+Github
item.description:
This article offers steps to build a blog.(Assume the hugo has been installed properly in your PC.)

Hugo install

Clone the theme from the github repository

 

    hugo new site your-site-name   ## build your site
    cd your-site-name/themes      ## change the direction to your-site-name/themes
    git clone https://github.com/author/theme-name.git  ## replace the "author" and "theme-name"
    cd ..                         ## change the direction to your-site-name
    cp -r /themes/theme-name/exampleSite/*   
    ## copy the files in /themes/theme-name/exampleSite/ to your site folder(your-site-name)

Note** There are two config files ( config.toml and hugo.yaml ) in your site floder. You need to copy the items in hugo.yaml to config.toml , and delete the hugo.yaml. You can change the type of config file, either config.toml or config.yaml is ok. I preferconfig.yaml .

Build the blog 

hugo server -D   
## in your-site-name folder, run the code, you can see the website in local

There are some errors like.

1.empty website: ensure the exampleSite has been copyed to your-site-name folder and config.toml has been modified.

2. "render of "taxonomy" failed: execute of template failed"

: upgrade the version of Hugo. For windows: your can download the latest version of Hugo, and replace the previos .exe file.

Push the Public folder to your Github repository

For more information to build the your repository in the github, you may refer to the link.

cd pubilc    ## run the previous code, the public folder will be generated.
git init
git add .
git commit "First commit"
git remote add origin https://github.com/your-user-name/your-user-name.github.io.git
## connect the local site with your github repository
git push -u origin main ## -u or -f choose one 
git push -f origin main ## will replace the original version
